abstract: But the unusually heavy autumn snowstorm in the Northeast may have kept some potential ticket buyers at home.
snippet: But the unusually heavy autumn snowstorm in the Northeast may have kept some potential ticket buyers at home.
lead_paragraph: DreamWorks Animation's "Puss in Boots," a spin-off of that studio's "Shrek" franchise, was No. 1 at North American theaters over the weekend, taking in an estimated $34 million. An unusually heavy autumn snowstorm in the Northeast may have kept some potential ticket buyers at home: Hollywood had been expecting a total closer to $40 million. But "Puss in Boots," which cost about $130 million to make and was distributed by Paramount Pictures, received strong critical reviews and an A-minus from audiences in exit polls, opening up the possibility of solid sales in weekends ahead.

headline.main: 'Puss in Boots' Leads at Weekend Box Office
